title: Shaky chat screen if receiving new messages and they are not currently vissible
body:
[comment]: # (Please replace ... with your information. Remove < and >) ### User Story As a user, I don't want the screen to be shaky when reading old messages so that I would have a smooth user experience. ### Description [comment]: # (Feature or Bug? i.e Type: Bug) *Type*: Bug [comment]: # (Describe the feature you would like, or briefly summarise the bug and what you did, what you expected to happen, and what actually happens. Sections below) *Summary*: When an end-user scrolls-up a long conversation the screen shakes slightly everytime when a new message arrives. #### Expected behavior [comment]: # (Describe what you expected to happen.) The screen should not be shaky when receiving new messages. #### Actual behavior [comment]: # (Describe what actually happened.) It is moving slightly as you can see on the video here: https://youtu.be/FbMnGIgU0hI You can observe the described behavior between 0:04 and 0:11. ### Reproduction [comment]: # (Describe how we can replicate the bug step by step.) - Open Status - Login - Open a chat conversation (doesn't matter if it's 1:1 or a public chat) containing multiple chat messages (longer than 1 screen size) - Scroll up until at least a few of the last messages remain hidden - Wait for a new message to arrive ### Additional Information [comment]: # (Please do your best to fill this out.) * Status version: 0.9.21 (6126) , Nightly build "June 26", http://artifacts.status.im:8081/artifactory/nightlies-local/im.status.ethereum-9a3483-n-fl.apk [comment]: # (Android or iOS.) * Operating System: Tested on Android.
